intro: Paraderris hancei, commonly known as the Hance's paraderris, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
